intro: Melicope haleakalae, commonly known as the Haleakalā melicope, is a rare endemic plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for native Hawaiian birds and insects. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is critically endangered and listed on the IUCN Red List. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique species.
